result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy J Matthews is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy J Matthews was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Timothy J Matthews was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 11CF632.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
10/20/15 Crt ordered ct 4 sentence to be amended to reflect that prison time is concurrent to 11CF632 and concurrent to any other sentence def is serving. All else remains the same.

superMiscConds.notes: $1267  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 24 mo.
